two_factor_authentication.Phishing_Attacks: Attackers trick users through deceptive emails or fake websites.
two_factor_authentication.Credential_Theft: Malware captures both password and 2FA code.
two_factor_authentication.Social_Engineering: Attackers manipulate users to reveal 2FA methods.

multi_factor_authentication.Credential_Stuffing: Attackers use leaked credentials due to reused passwords.
multi_factor_authentication.MFA_Token_Interception: Attackers intercept or reuse MFA tokens.

security_monitoring.False_Positives_Negatives: Ineffective monitoring generates false alarms or misses attacks.

data_privacy_policy.Data_Breach: Attackers exploit vulnerabilities to expose sensitive data.
data_privacy_policy.Unsecured_Sharing: Users share sensitive data with unauthorized parties.
data_privacy_policy.Non_Compliance_Penalties: Non-compliance leads to penalties and damage.

secure_file_uploads.Server_Overload: Attackers overwhelm servers with large files.
secure_file_uploads.Data_Tampering: Malicious users modify files during upload.

secure_file_uploads_policies__properties.Malicious_Naming: Attackers use deceptive names for malicious content.
secure_file_uploads_policies__properties.Policy_Violation: Violating naming conventions leads to access.

secure_file_uploads_policies__properties.Privilege_Escalation: Attackers escalate privileges and tamper logs.
secure_file_uploads_policies__properties.Retention_Policy_Violation: Failure to retain logs leads to gaps.

ssl_encryption_required.Expired_Invalid_Certificates: Use of expired or invalid certificates enables impersonation.
ssl_encryption_required.Certificate_Mismanagement: Poor certificate management leads to issuance.
